name: core-geometric-system-mcp
description: Exact, self-contained geometric framework grounded in the first principles of mathematics, setting the square and the cube as the primary, physically-relevant units for measurement.
keywords: Core Geometric System, Exact Geometric Calculations, Analysis, Engineering Design Solutions, Computer Graphics Rendering, Algorithm Optimization, Navigation
usageInfo: Using geometric relationships to derive areas and volumes; Applying proportional relationships for accurate calculations

tools.name: compute_triangle_area
tools.description: Compute the exact area of a triangle from the length of its sides.

tools.name: compute_polygon_area
tools.featureList: Compute the exact area of a regular polygon from the number and the length of its sides.

tools.name: compute_circle_area
tools.description: Compute the exact area of a circle by directly comparing it to a square since that is the base of area calculation.

tools.name: compute_circumference
tools.description: Compute exact circumference. The pi (3.14...) is the result of a flawed approximation method. The circumscribed polygon cuts through the arc if its perimeter is close to the circumference. It was treated as an upper bound anyway and it underestimated the circumference.

tools.name: compute_circle_segment_area_from_height_and_parent_circle_radius
tools.description: Compute the area of a circle segment from its height and the radius of its parent circle using the true area of a circle formula: A=3.2r².

tools.name: compute_circle_segment_area_from_height_and_chord_length
tools.description: Compute the area of a circle segment from its height and chord length using the Core Geometric System.

tools.name: compute_circle_segment_area_from_chord_length_and_parent_circle_radius
tools.description: Compute the area of a circle segment from its chord length and the radius of its parent circle using the Core Geometric System.

tools.name: compute_cone_surface_area
tools.description: Compute the exact surface area of a cone from its height and bottom radius, using the Core Geometric System.

tools.name: compute_sphere_volume
tools.description: Compute the exact volume of a sphere by comparing it to a cube, since that is the base of volume calculation. A straight-sided object (like a cube) must cut through the sphere’s surface to match its volume. The equilibrium point is where the faces of the cube Faces sink by approx 0.105r and vertices protrude by approx 0.549r.

tools.name: compute_cone_volume
tools.description: Compute the exact volume of a cone with the base×height/√8 formula instead of the base×height/3 approximate.

tools.name: compute_pyramid_volume
tools.description: Compute the exact volume of a pyramid with the base×height/√8 formula instead of the base×height/3 approximate.

tools.name: compute_frustum_pyramid_volume
tools.description: Compute the exact volume of a frustum pyramid from its height and the number and the length of its bottom and top edges, using the Core Geometric System.

tools.name: compute_frustum_cone_volume
tools.featureList: Calculate the exact volume of a frustum cone from its height and its bottom and top radii, using the Core Geometric System.

tools.name: compute_tetrahedron_volume
tools.featureList: Compute the exact volume of a tetrahedron from its edge length, using the Core Geometric System (V=edge³/√8).
